title: Schindler's List movie poster logo
content:
Greetings,  
Can anybody identify the headline font used in the Schindler's List poster?

Thanks for helping!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [schindlers\_list.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20111208233244/http:/typophile.com/files/schindlers_list.jpg) | 133.3 KB |
author: malbright

comments.content: I am betting on hand drawn.

It might be based on [Edwardian](http://web.archive.org/web/20111208233244/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/edwardian), which I found after being reminded of [Sparrowhawk's](http://web.archive.org/web/20111208233244/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/device/sparrowhawk/regular) curved bars and other parts. The N and H especially bear a resemblance, although other letters diverge in what seems to be a custom job (as Stephen and David said).

Here's another one that might have been an inspiration: [Blackfriar](http://web.archive.org/web/20111208233244/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.htm?pid=203630).

Skylar

Nice find, Skylar. Fonts.com's showings are awfully small. [Here's a better look at it.](http://web.archive.org/web/20111208233244/http:/www.identifont.com/find?font=blackfriar) Quite the devil 'g' there.

A bicorn "g", standard! A keeper for sure.

hhp
